00033 #include <assert.h>
00034 #include <ctype.h>
00035 #include <stdio.h>

00045 /***********************************************************************
00046  * TOKEN MATCH FUNCTIONS - These functions are used by cparser_match()
00047  *     to check if a token matches a node type.
00048  ***********************************************************************/
00049 /*
00050  * cparser_match_root - Token matching function for root. There is no
00051  *     parsing for root node. Parser should crash if this function 
00052  *     is ever called.
00053  */
00054 cparser_result_t 
00055 cparser_match_root (const char *token, const int token_len, 
00056                     cparser_node_t *node, int *is_complete)
00057 {
00058     assert(node && (CPARSER_NODE_ROOT == node->type));
00059     assert(0); /* we should never try to match a root node */
00060     return CPARSER_NOT_OK;
00061 }
00062 
00063 /*
00064  * cparser_match_end - Token matching function for end. There is no
00065  *     parsing for end node. It always returns no match.
00066  */
00067 cparser_result_t 
00068 cparser_match_end (const char *token, const int token_len, 
00069                    cparser_node_t *node, int *is_complete)
00070 {
00071     assert(node && (CPARSER_NODE_END == node->type));
00072     return CPARSER_NOT_OK;
00073 }
00074 
00075 /*
00076  * cparser_match_keyword - Token matching function for keywords. It can 
00077  *     be alphanumeric string with '-' and '_'.
00078  */
00079 cparser_result_t
00080 cparser_match_keyword (const char *token, const int token_len, 
00081                        cparser_node_t *node, int *is_complete)
00082 {
00083     int kw_len, match_len;
00084 
00085     assert(token && node && (CPARSER_NODE_KEYWORD == node->type) && is_complete);
00086 
00087     //kw_len = strnlen(node->param, CPARSER_MAX_TOKEN_SIZE);
00088     kw_len = strlen(node->param);
00089     if (token_len > kw_len) {
00090     *is_complete = 0;
00091     return CPARSER_NOT_OK;
00092     }
00093     match_len = (kw_len < token_len ? kw_len : token_len);
00094     
00095     if (!strncmp(token, node->param, match_len)) {
00096     *is_complete = (match_len == kw_len);
00097     return CPARSER_OK;
00098     }
00099 
00100     *is_complete = 0;
00101     return CPARSER_NOT_OK;
00102 }
00103 
00104 /*
00105  * cparser_match_string - Token matching function for strings. There is 
00106  *     no restriction on strings.
00107  */
00108 cparser_result_t
00109 cparser_match_string (const char *token, const int token_len, 
00110                       cparser_node_t *node, int *is_complete)
00111 {
00112     assert(token && node && (CPARSER_NODE_STRING == node->type) && is_complete);
00113     *is_complete = 1;
00114     return CPARSER_OK;
00115 }
00116 
00117 /*
00118  * cparser_match_uint - Token matching function for 32-bit or 64-bit unsigned 
00119  *     decimals or hexadecimals. Match against /[0-9]+|0x[0-9a-fA-F]+/.
00120  */
00121 cparser_result_t
00122 cparser_match_uint (const char *token, const int token_len, 
00123                     cparser_node_t *node, int *is_complete)
00124 {
00125     int n, is_dec = 1;
00126  
00127     assert(token && node && is_complete && 
00128            ((CPARSER_NODE_UINT == node->type) || 
00129             (CPARSER_NODE_UINT64 == node->type)));
00130 
00131     *is_complete = 0;
00132     assert(token_len > 0);
00133     /* The first character must be 0-9 */
00134     if (!isdigit(token[0])) return CPARSER_NOT_OK;
00135     if (1 == token_len) {
00136     *is_complete = 1;
00137     return CPARSER_OK;
00138     }
00139 
00140     /* The 2nd character (optional) must be 0-9 or 'x' */
00141     if ('x' == token[1]) {
00142     if ('0' != token[0]) {
00143         return CPARSER_NOT_OK;
00144     }
00145     is_dec = 0;
00146     } else if (!isdigit(token[1])) {
00147     return CPARSER_NOT_OK;
00148     }
00149     if (2 == token_len) {
00150     *is_complete = is_dec;
00151     return CPARSER_OK;
00152     }
00153 
00154     /*
00155      * The rest of characters are either decmial or hex depending on
00156      * the first 2 characters are equal to '0x' or not 
00157      */
00158     if (is_dec) {
00159     for (n = 2; n < token_len; n++) {
00160         if (!isdigit(token[n])) return CPARSER_NOT_OK;
00161     }
00162     } else {
00163     for (n = 2; n < token_len; n++) {
00164         if (!isxdigit(token[n])) return CPARSER_NOT_OK;
00165     }
00166     }
00167     *is_complete = 1;
00168     return CPARSER_OK;
00169 }
00170 
00171 /*
00172  * cparser_match_int - Token matching function for 32-bit or 64-bit signed 
00173  *     decimals. Match against /[01]{0,1}[0-9]+/.
00174  */
00175 cparser_result_t
00176 cparser_match_int (const char *token, const int token_len, 
00177                    cparser_node_t *node, int *is_complete)
00178 {
00179     int n;
00180 
00181     assert(token && node && is_complete &&
00182            ((CPARSER_NODE_INT == node->type) || 
00183             (CPARSER_NODE_INT64 == node->type)));
00184 
00185     *is_complete = 0;
00186     assert(token_len > 0);
00187 
00188     /* 1st digit can be 0-9,-,+ */
00189     if (!isdigit(token[0]) && ('-' != token[0]) && ('+' != token[0])) 
00190     return CPARSER_NOT_OK;
00191     if (1 == token_len) {
00192     if (isdigit(token[0])) *is_complete =  1;
00193     return CPARSER_OK;
00194     }
00195 
00196     /* All subsequent characters must be digits */
00197     for (n = 1; n < token_len; n++) {
00198     if (!isdigit(token[n])) return CPARSER_NOT_OK;
00199     }
00200     *is_complete = 1;
00201     return CPARSER_OK;
00202 }
00203 
00204 /*
00205  * cparser_match_hex - Token matching function for 32-bit or 64-bit 
00206  *     hexadecimals.
00207  */
00208 cparser_result_t
00209 cparser_match_hex (const char *token, const int token_len, 
00210                    cparser_node_t *node, int *is_complete)
00211 {
00212     int n;
00213 
00214     assert(token && node && is_complete && 
00215            ((CPARSER_NODE_HEX == node->type) || 
00216             (CPARSER_NODE_HEX64 == node->type)));
00217 
00218     *is_complete = 0;
00219     assert(token_len > 0);
00220     if ('0' != token[0]) return CPARSER_NOT_OK;
00221     if (1 == token_len) return CPARSER_OK;
00222     if ('x' != token[1]) return CPARSER_NOT_OK;
00223     if (2 == token_len) return CPARSER_OK;
00224     for (n = 2; n < token_len; n++) {
00225     if (!isxdigit(token[n])) return CPARSER_NOT_OK;
00226     }
00227     *is_complete = 1;
00228     return CPARSER_OK;
00229 }
00230 
00231 /*
00232  * cparser_match_float - Token matching function for double precision floating 
00233  *     point value.
00234  */
00235 cparser_result_t
00236 cparser_match_float (const char *token, const int token_len, 
00237                      cparser_node_t *node, int *is_complete)
00238 {
00239     int base = 0, has_dec_pt = 0, n;
00240     assert(token && node && (CPARSER_NODE_FLOAT == node->type) && is_complete);
00241     *is_complete = 0;
00242     assert(token_len > 0);
00243 
00244     /* Handle '+', '-' separately */
00245     if (('+' == token[base]) || ('-' == token[base])) {
00246         if (1 == token_len) {
00247             return CPARSER_OK;
00248         }
00249         base++;
00250     }
00251 
00252     /* Handle a first '.' */
00253     if ('.' == token[base]) {
00254         if (2 == token_len) {
00255             return CPARSER_OK;
00256         }
00257         has_dec_pt = 1;
00258     } else if (!isdigit(token[base])) {
00259         return CPARSER_NOT_OK;
00260     }
00261 
00262     /* Work on the rest of them */
00263     *is_complete = 1;
00264     for (n = base; n < token_len; n++) {
00265         if ('.' == token[n]) {
00266             if (has_dec_pt) {
00267                 *is_complete = 0;
00268                 return CPARSER_NOT_OK;
00269             }
00270             has_dec_pt = 1;
00271             continue;
00272         }
00273         if (!isdigit(token[n])) {
00274             return CPARSER_NOT_OK;
00275         }
00276     }
00277     return CPARSER_OK;
00278 }
00279 
00280 /*
00281  * cparser_match_macaddr - Token matching function for 48-bit MAC address.
00282  *     Match against /($hex{1,2}:){5,5}$hex/ where $hex = "[0-9a-fA-F]".
00283  */
00284 cparser_result_t
00285 cparser_match_macaddr (const char *token, const int token_len, 
00286                        cparser_node_t *node, int *is_complete)
00287 {
00288     int n, num_digit = 0, num_colon = 0;
00289 
00290     assert(token && node && (CPARSER_NODE_MACADDR == node->type));
00291     *is_complete = 0;
00292     for (n = 0; n < token_len; n++) {
00293     if (!num_digit) {
00294         if (!isxdigit(token[n])) return CPARSER_NOT_OK;
00295         num_digit = 1;
00296     } else if (1 == num_digit) {
00297         if (!isxdigit(token[n]) && (':' != token[n])) return CPARSER_NOT_OK;
00298         num_digit = 2;
00299         if (':' == token[n]) {
00300         num_colon++;
00301         if (num_colon > 5) return CPARSER_NOT_OK;
00302         num_digit = 0;
00303         }
00304     } else {
00305         if (':' != token[n]) return CPARSER_NOT_OK;
00306         num_colon++;
00307         if (num_colon > 5) return CPARSER_NOT_OK;
00308         num_digit = 0;
00309     }
00310     }
00311     if ((5 == num_colon) && (0 < num_digit)) *is_complete = 1;
00312     return CPARSER_OK;
00313 }
00314 
00315 /*
00316  * cparser_match_ipv4addr - Token matching function for IPv4 address.
00317  *     Match against /([0-9]{1,3}\.){3,3}[0-9]{1,3}/
00318  */
00319 cparser_result_t
00320 cparser_match_ipv4addr (const char *token, const int token_len, 
00321                         cparser_node_t *node, int *is_complete)
00322 {
00323     int n, num_digit = 0, num_dot = 0;
00324 
00325     assert(token && node && (CPARSER_NODE_IPV4ADDR == node->type));
00326     *is_complete = 0;
00327     for (n = 0; n < token_len; n++) {
00328     assert((unsigned int)num_digit < 4);
00329     if (!num_digit) {
00330         if (!isdigit(token[n])) return CPARSER_NOT_OK;
00331         num_digit++;
00332     } else if (3 == num_digit) {
00333         if ('.' != token[n]) return CPARSER_NOT_OK;
00334         num_dot++;
00335         if (num_dot > 3) return CPARSER_NOT_OK;
00336         num_digit = 0;
00337     } else {
00338         if (!isdigit(token[n]) && ('.' != token[n])) return CPARSER_NOT_OK;
00339         num_digit++;
00340         if ('.' == token[n]) {
00341         num_dot++;
00342         if (num_dot > 3) return CPARSER_NOT_OK;
00343         num_digit = 0;
00344         } else if (3 == num_digit) {
00345                 char a[4] = { token[n-2], token[n-1], token[n] };
00346                 char b[4] = "255";
00347                 if (0 < strncmp(a, b, 3)) return CPARSER_NOT_OK;
00348             }
00349     }
00350     }
00351     if ((3 == num_dot) && (0 < num_digit)) *is_complete = 1;
00352     return CPARSER_OK;
00353 }
00354 
00355 /*
00356  * cparser_match_file - Token matching function for a file path. Treat
00357  *     this like a string.
00358  */
00359 cparser_result_t
00360 cparser_match_file (const char *token, const int token_len, 
00361                     cparser_node_t *node, int *is_complete)
00362 {
00363     assert(token && node && (CPARSER_NODE_FILE == node->type) && is_complete);
00364     *is_complete = 1;
00365     return CPARSER_OK;
00366 }
00367 
00368 /*
00369  * cparser_match_list - Token matching function for a LIST token.
00370  */
00371 cparser_result_t
00372 cparser_match_list (const char *token, const int token_len, 
00373                     cparser_node_t *node, int *is_complete)
00374 {
00375     cparser_list_node_t *lnode;
00376     unsigned int num_matches = 0;
00377     assert(token && node && (CPARSER_NODE_LIST == node->type) && is_complete);
00378     
00379     lnode = (cparser_list_node_t *)node->param;
00380     assert(lnode);
00381     while (lnode) {
00382         if (!strncmp(token, lnode->keyword, token_len)) {
00383             num_matches++;
00384         }
00385         lnode = lnode->next;
00386     }
00387     *is_complete = (1 == num_matches ? 1 : 0);
00388 
00389     return (num_matches ? CPARSER_OK : CPARSER_NOT_OK);
00390 }
00391 
00392 /***********************************************************************
00393  * TOKEN COMPLETE FUNCTIONS - These functions are used by 
00394  *     cparser_complete_one_level() to provide context-sensitive 
00395  *     completion.
00396  ***********************************************************************/
00397 cparser_result_t
00398 cparser_complete_keyword (cparser_t *parser, const cparser_node_t *node,
00399                           const char *token, const int token_len)
00400 {
00401     int rc;
00402     char *ch_ptr;
00403 
00404     assert(parser && node && token && (CPARSER_NODE_KEYWORD == node->type));
00405     ch_ptr = node->param + token_len;
00406     while (*ch_ptr) {
00407         rc = cparser_input(parser, *ch_ptr, CPARSER_CHAR_REGULAR);
00408         assert(CPARSER_OK == rc);
00409         ch_ptr++;
00410     }
00411     return CPARSER_OK;
00412 }
00413 
00414 /*
00415  * cparser_complete_file - Token complete function for a file path.
00416  */
00417 cparser_result_t
00418 cparser_complete_file (cparser_t *parser, const cparser_node_t *node,
00419                        const char *token, const int token_len)
00420 {
00421     int rc, n;
00422     glob_t matches;
00423 
00424     assert(parser && node && token && (CPARSER_NODE_FILE == node->type) && token_len);
00425 
00426     /* Check if there is any files that matches this */
00427     rc = glob(token, 0, NULL, &matches);
00428     if (rc) {
00429         globfree(&matches);
00430         return CPARSER_NOT_OK;
00431     }
00432 
00433     /* If there is exactly one match, complete it */
00434     if (1 == matches.gl_pathc) {
00435         size_t path_len = strlen(matches.gl_pathv[0]);
00436         for (n = token_len; n < path_len; n++) {
00437             rc = cparser_input(parser, matches.gl_pathv[0][n], CPARSER_CHAR_REGULAR);
00438             assert(CPARSER_OK == rc);            
00439         }
00440     }
00441     /* hack alert - add support for multiple partial matches */
00442     return CPARSER_OK;
00443 }
00444 
00445 /*
00446  * cparser_complete_list - Token complete function for a LIST token.
00447  */
00448 cparser_result_t
00449 cparser_complete_list (cparser_t *parser, const cparser_node_t *node,
00450                        const char *token, const int token_len)
00451 {
00452     cparser_list_node_t *lnode, *match_lnode = NULL;
00453     int match_len = -1, n;
00454     cparser_result_t rc = CPARSER_NOT_OK;
00455 
00456     assert(parser && node && token && (CPARSER_NODE_LIST == node->type) && token_len);
00457     /* Find the longest common suffix if it exists */
00458     for (lnode = node->param; NULL != lnode; lnode = lnode->next) {
00459         if (!strncmp(lnode->keyword, token, token_len)) {
00460             /* Prefix matches. See what is the longest suffix */
00461             if (-1 == match_len) {
00462                 /* First match. Cover the whole thing */
00463                 match_len = strlen(lnode->keyword);
00464                 assert(!match_lnode);
00465                 match_lnode = lnode;
00466             } else {
00467                 /* Second and after matches. Intersect with previous match */
00468                 for (n = token_len; n < match_len; n++) {
00469                     if (lnode->keyword[n] != match_lnode->keyword[n]) {
00470                         break;
00471                     }
00472                 }
00473                 match_len = n;
00474             }
00475         }
00476     }
00477 
00478     /* If a common prefix is found, input it */
00479     if (0 < match_len) {
00480         assert(match_lnode);
00481         for (n = token_len; n < match_len; n++) {
00482             rc = cparser_input(parser, match_lnode->keyword[n], CPARSER_CHAR_REGULAR);
00483             assert(CPARSER_OK == rc);
00484         }
00485         rc = CPARSER_OK;
00486     }
00487 
00488     return rc;
00489 }
00490 
00491 /***********************************************************************
00492  * TOKEN GET FUNCTIONS - These functions are used by glue functions
00493  *     to extract the parameters and call the action function.
00494  ***********************************************************************/
00495 /*
00496  * cparser_get_string - Token get function for a string.
00497  */
00498 cparser_result_t
00499 cparser_get_string (const cparser_token_t *token, void *value)
00500 {
00501     char **val = (char **)value;
00502     assert(token && val);
00503     if (!token->token_len) {
00504         *val = NULL;
00505         return CPARSER_NOT_OK; /* optional argument wasn't provided */
00506     }
00507     *val = (char *)token->buf;
00508     return CPARSER_OK;
00509 }
00510 
00511 /*
00512  * cparser_get_uint_internal - Token get function for 32-bit unsigned integer.
00513  */
00514 static cparser_result_t
00515 cparser_get_uint_internal (const char *token, const int token_len, void *value)
00516 {
00517     uint32_t new = 0, old, d = 0, n;
00518     uint32_t *val = (uint32_t *)value;
00519 
00520     assert(token && val);
00521     *val = old = 0;
00522     for (n = 0; n < token_len; n++) {
00523     if (('0' <= token[n]) && ('9' >= token[n])) {
00524         d = token[n] - '0';
00525     } else {
00526         assert(0); /* not a hex digit! */
00527     }
00528     new = (old * 10) + d;
00529     if (((new - d) / 10) != old) return CPARSER_NOT_OK;
00530     old = new;
00531     }
00532     *val = new;
00533     return CPARSER_OK;
00534 }
00535 
00536 /*
00537  * cparser_get_uint64_internal - Token get function for 64-bit unsigned integer.
00538  */
00539 static cparser_result_t
00540 cparser_get_uint64_internal (const char *token, const int token_len, void *value)
00541 {
00542     uint64_t new = 0, old, d = 0, n;
00543     uint64_t *val = (uint64_t *)value;
00544 
00545     assert(token && val);
00546     *val = old = 0;
00547     for (n = 0; n < token_len; n++) {
00548     if (('0' <= token[n]) && ('9' >= token[n])) {
00549         d = token[n] - '0';
00550     } else {
00551         assert(0); /* not a hex digit! */
00552     }
00553     new = (old * 10) + d;
00554     if (((new - d) / 10) != old) return CPARSER_NOT_OK;
00555     old = new;
00556     }
00557     *val = new;
00558     return CPARSER_OK;
00559 }
00560 
00561 /*
00562  * cparser_get_uint - Token get function for 32-bit unsigned integer.
00563  */
00564 cparser_result_t
00565 cparser_get_uint (const cparser_token_t *token, void *value)
00566 {
00567     assert(token && value);
00568 
00569     if (!token->token_len) {
00570         *((uint32_t *)value) = 0;
00571         return CPARSER_NOT_OK; /* optional argument wasn't provided */
00572     }
00573     if ((1 < token->token_len) && ('x' == token->buf[1])) {
00574     /* Hexadecmial format use cparser_get_hex() */
00575     return cparser_get_hex(token, value);
00576     }
00577     return cparser_get_uint_internal(token->buf, token->token_len, value);
00578 }
00579 
00580 /*
00581  * cparser_get_uint64 - Token get function for 64-bit unsigned integer.
00582  */
00583 cparser_result_t
00584 cparser_get_uint64 (const cparser_token_t *token, void *value)
00585 {
00586     assert(token && value);
00587 
00588     if (!token->token_len) {
00589         *((uint64_t *)value) = 0;
00590         return CPARSER_NOT_OK; /* optional argument wasn't provided */
00591     }
00592     if ((1 < token->token_len) && ('x' == token->buf[1])) {
00593     /* Hexadecmial format use cparser_get_hex64() */
00594     return cparser_get_hex64(token, value);
00595     }
00596     return cparser_get_uint64_internal(token->buf, token->token_len, value);
00597 }
00598 
00599 /*
00600  * cparser_get_int - Token get function for 32-bit integer.
00601  */
00602 cparser_result_t
00603 cparser_get_int (const cparser_token_t *token, void *value)
00604 {
00605     int32_t sign = +1, *val = (int32_t *)value;
00606     uint32_t tmp, init_pos = 0;
00607 
00608     assert(token && val);
00609     *val = 0;
00610     if (!token->token_len) {
00611         return CPARSER_NOT_OK; /* optional argument wasn't provided */
00612     }
00613     assert(token->token_len > 0);
00614     if ('-' == token->buf[0]) {
00615     sign = -1;
00616     init_pos = 1;
00617     }
00618     if ('+' == token->buf[0]) {
00619     init_pos = 1;
00620     }
00621     if (CPARSER_OK != cparser_get_uint_internal(&token->buf[init_pos], 
00622                                                 token->token_len - init_pos, 
00623                                                 &tmp)) {
00624     return CPARSER_NOT_OK;
00625     }
00626     if (+1 == sign) {
00627     if (tmp > 0x7fffffff) return CPARSER_NOT_OK;
00628     *val = (int32_t)tmp;
00629     } else {
00630     assert(-1 == sign);
00631     if (tmp > 0x80000000) return CPARSER_NOT_OK;
00632     *val = -((int32_t)tmp);
00633     }
00634     return CPARSER_OK;
00635 }
00636 
00637 /*
00638  * cparser_get_int64 - Token get function for 64-bit integer.
00639  */
00640 cparser_result_t
00641 cparser_get_int64 (const cparser_token_t *token, void *value)
00642 {
00643     int64_t sign = +1, *val = (int64_t *)value;
00644     uint64_t tmp, init_pos = 0;
00645 
00646     assert(token && val);
00647     *val = 0;
00648     if (!token->token_len) {
00649         return CPARSER_NOT_OK; /* optional argument wasn't provided */
00650     }
00651     assert(token->token_len > 0);
00652     if ('-' == token->buf[0]) {
00653     sign = -1;
00654     init_pos = 1;
00655     }
00656     if ('+' == token->buf[0]) {
00657     init_pos = 1;
00658     }
00659     if (CPARSER_OK != cparser_get_uint64_internal(&token->buf[init_pos], 
00660                                                   token->token_len - init_pos, 
00661                                                   &tmp)) {
00662     return CPARSER_NOT_OK;
00663     }
00664     if (+1 == sign) {
00665     if (tmp > 0x7fffffffffffffffULL) return CPARSER_NOT_OK;
00666     *val = (int64_t)tmp;
00667     } else {
00668     assert(-1 == sign);
00669     if (tmp > 0x8000000000000000ULL) return CPARSER_NOT_OK;
00670     *val = -((int64_t)tmp);
00671     }
00672     return CPARSER_OK;
00673 }
00674 
00675 /*
00676  * cparser_get_hex - Token get function for 32-bit hexadecimal.
00677  */
00678 cparser_result_t
00679 cparser_get_hex (const cparser_token_t *token, void *value)
00680 {
00681     int n;
00682     uint32_t new = 0, old, d = 0, *val = (uint32_t *)value;
00683 
00684     assert(token && val);
00685     if (!token->token_len) {
00686         *val = 0;
00687         return CPARSER_NOT_OK; /* optional argument wasn't provided */
00688     }
00689     assert((token->token_len > 2) && ('0' == token->buf[0]) && ('x' == token->buf[1]));
00690     *val = old = 0;
00691     for (n = 2; n < token->token_len; n++) {
00692     if (('0' <= token->buf[n]) && ('9' >= token->buf[n])) {
00693         d = token->buf[n] - '0';
00694     } else if (('a' <= token->buf[n]) && ('f' >= token->buf[n])) {
00695         d = token->buf[n] - 'a' + 10;
00696     } else if (('A' <= token->buf[n]) && ('F' >= token->buf[n])) {
00697         d = token->buf[n] - 'A' + 10;
00698     } else {
00699         assert(0); /* not a hex digit! */
00700     }
00701     new = (old << 4) + d;
00702     if (((new - d) >> 4) != old) return CPARSER_NOT_OK;
00703     old = new;
00704     }
00705     *val = new;
00706     return CPARSER_OK;
00707 }
00708 
00709 /*
00710  * cparser_get_hex64 - Token get function for 64-bit hexadecimal.
00711  */
00712 cparser_result_t
00713 cparser_get_hex64 (const cparser_token_t *token, void *value)
00714 {
00715     int n;
00716     uint64_t new = 0, old, d = 0, *val = (uint64_t *)value;
00717 
00718     assert(token && val);
00719     if (!token->token_len) {
00720         *val = 0;
00721         return CPARSER_NOT_OK; /* optional argument wasn't provided */
00722     }
00723     assert((token->token_len > 2) && ('0' == token->buf[0]) && ('x' == token->buf[1]));
00724     *val = old = 0;
00725     for (n = 2; n < token->token_len; n++) {
00726     if (('0' <= token->buf[n]) && ('9' >= token->buf[n])) {
00727         d = token->buf[n] - '0';
00728     } else if (('a' <= token->buf[n]) && ('f' >= token->buf[n])) {
00729         d = token->buf[n] - 'a' + 10;
00730     } else if (('A' <= token->buf[n]) && ('F' >= token->buf[n])) {
00731         d = token->buf[n] - 'A' + 10;
00732     } else {
00733         assert(0); /* not a hex digit! */
00734     }
00735     new = (old << 4) + d;
00736     if (((new - d) >> 4) != old) return CPARSER_NOT_OK;
00737     old = new;
00738     }
00739     *val = new;
00740     return CPARSER_OK;
00741 }
00742 
00743 /*
00744  * cparser_get_float - Token get function for 64-bit floating point value.
00745  */
00746 cparser_result_t
00747 cparser_get_float (const cparser_token_t *token, void *value)
00748 {
00749     double *val = (double *)value;
00750 
00751     assert(token && val);
00752     if (!token->token_len) {
00753         return CPARSER_NOT_OK; /* optional argument wasn't provided */
00754     }
00755     if (1 != sscanf(token->buf, "%lf", val)) {
00756         *val = 0.0;
00757         return CPARSER_NOT_OK;
00758     }
00759     return CPARSER_OK;
00760 }
00761 
00762 /*
00763  * cparser_get_macaddr - Token get function for MAC address.
00764  */
00765 cparser_result_t
00766 cparser_get_macaddr (const cparser_token_t *token, void *value)
00767 {
00768     unsigned long a, b, c, d, e, f;
00769     cparser_macaddr_t *val = (cparser_macaddr_t *)value;
00770 
00771     assert(token && val);
00772     if (!token->token_len) {
00773         memset(val, 0, sizeof(*val));
00774         return CPARSER_NOT_OK; /* optional argument wasn't provided */
00775     }
00776     if ((6 != sscanf(token->buf, "%lx:%lx:%lx:%lx:%lx:%lx", 
00777              &a, &b, &c, &d, &e, &f)) ||
00778     (a > 255) || (b > 255) || (c > 255) || (d > 255) || (e > 255) || 
00779     (f > 255)) {
00780     val->octet[0] = val->octet[1] = val->octet[2] = 
00781             val->octet[3] = val->octet[4] = val->octet[5] = 0;
00782     return CPARSER_NOT_OK;
00783     }
00784     val->octet[0] = (uint8_t)a;
00785     val->octet[1] = (uint8_t)b;
00786     val->octet[2] = (uint8_t)c;
00787     val->octet[3] = (uint8_t)d;
00788     val->octet[4] = (uint8_t)e;
00789     val->octet[5] = (uint8_t)f;
00790 
00791     return CPARSER_OK;
00792 }
00793 
00794 /*
00795  * cparser_get_ipv4addr - Token get function for IPv4 address.
00796  */
00797 cparser_result_t
00798 cparser_get_ipv4addr (const cparser_token_t *token, void *value)
00799 {
00800     unsigned long a, b, c, d;
00801     uint32_t *val = (uint32_t *)value;
00802 
00803     assert(token && val);
00804     if (!token->token_len) {
00805         *val = 0;
00806         return CPARSER_NOT_OK; /* optional argument wasn't provided */
00807     }
00808     if ((4 != sscanf(token->buf, "%lu.%lu.%lu.%lu", &a, &b, &c, &d)) ||
00809     (a > 255) || (b > 255) || (c > 255) || (d > 255)) {
00810         *val = 0;
00811     return CPARSER_NOT_OK;
00812     }
00813     *val = ((uint32_t)a) << 24;
00814     *val |= ((uint32_t)b) << 16;
00815     *val |= ((uint32_t)c) << 8;
00816     *val |= ((uint32_t)d);
00817     
00818     return CPARSER_OK;
00819 }
00820 
00821 /*
00822  * cparser_get_file - Token get function for file path.
00823  */
00824 cparser_result_t
00825 cparser_get_file (const cparser_token_t *token, void *value)
00826 {
00827     struct stat stat_buf;
00828     char **val = (char **)value;
00829 
00830     assert(token && val);
00831     *val = NULL;
00832     if (!token->token_len) {
00833         return CPARSER_NOT_OK; /* optional argument wasn't provided */
00834     }
00835     if (stat(token->buf, &stat_buf) || !(stat_buf.st_mode & S_IFREG)) {
00836     return CPARSER_NOT_OK;
00837     }
00838     *val = (char *)token->buf;
00839     return CPARSER_OK;
00840 }
00841 
00842 /*
00843  * cparser_get_list - Token get function for keyword list.
00844  */
00845 cparser_result_t
00846 cparser_get_list (const cparser_token_t *token, void *value)
00847 {
00848     char **ptr = (char **)value;
00849     cparser_list_node_t *lnode;
00850 
00851     assert(token);
00852     if (!token->node) {
00853         return CPARSER_NOT_OK;
00854     }
00855     assert(CPARSER_NODE_LIST == token->node->type);
00856 
00857     /*
00858      * We have to handle the case when only the substring of a unique
00859      * keyword is given. In this case, we must return the string
00860      * in the list node back instead of the one in the token. To 
00861      * simplify the logic, we return the string in the list node even
00862      * when the token contains the full keyword.
00863      */
00864     for (lnode = (cparser_list_node_t *)token->node->param;
00865          NULL != lnode; lnode = lnode->next) {
00866         int clen = strlen(lnode->keyword);
00867         if (clen > token->token_len) {
00868             clen = token->token_len; /* min. of token and keyword length */
00869         }
00870         if (!strncmp(token->buf, lnode->keyword, clen)) {
00871             *ptr = (char *)lnode->keyword;
00872             return CPARSER_OK;
00873         }
00874     }
00875 
00876     *ptr = NULL;
00877     return CPARSER_NOT_OK;
00878 }
